Subject:- 
Security measures  for  unaccompanied  baggage 
 
Unaccompanied    baggage is  an item of  hold  baggage  that has 
become  separated from the owner  due to  a  break down in the  baggage  
handling system or  any  other reasons  at  some  point  in its  journey.  The 
following  security measures  shall be  implemented  by the  aircraft  operators 
operating  to/ from/ within India :- 
 
(i) 
Each item of  unaccompanied  hold  baggage  must  be 
accounted  for  on the  hold  baggage  manifest clearly showing 
that  the item has  unaccompanied status with  a suitable entry 
made  on the  hold  baggage  manifest together with the  
baggage tag number to indicate this; 
(ii) 
Each  unaccompanied  hold  baggage  shall be accounted  for  
on a separate  hold   baggage record card  from that  used  for  
accompanied  hold  baggage; 
(iii) 
Each  item of  unaccompanied  hold baggage  must be 
subjected  to  at least  one of the following enhanced security 
controls: 
 
(a) 
Search  by hand;  screening through x-ray equipment 
from at least  two different  angles in succession by 
the same  screener; 
(b) 
Screening  through  an explosive detection system 
either  automatic  mode  or   in the indicative mode ie.  
Where the x-ray image  is presented  to the  x-ray 
operator  for assessment and decision; 
 
(iv) 
The  trained and certified  screener,  when undertaking the  checks 
of  unaccompanied   hold baggage shall  satisfy  himself  that  each 
item  of unaccompanied   hold  baggage  has been  subjected to 
the  appropriate enhanced  security controls.

(v) 
The trained and  certified  screener  shall  furnish a certificate  
confirming that the  unaccompanied  hold  has been subject to the   
specified  security controls and  the said  certificate shall be  
attached  to the  unaccompanied  hold    baggage portion  of the  
manifest  prior to  loading  in the aircraft.   
 
2. 
The above  instructions shall be implemented  with immediate effect.
